reviewText:
Product received for free

A Surreal Minimalistic Puzzle Exploration Gamehttps://youtu.be/2Pr9sZqb8qQ
+ The level design is unique, interesting, and a bit odd but makes for quite a thrilling new experience
+ Gameplay is fairly basic, you walk around and solve a variety of short interesting puzzles / challenges which are not too hard to solve.
+ Great use of ambient sounds to create a desolate eerie vibe for the player
+ Some creepy horror-like elements although they are a bit more shocking and strange than horrific

- In the time I played I noticed some bugs like getting stuck in walls, or triggers not activating properly which can easily be reset by restarting the level / game but a bit annoying.
- I felt like more story elements would have helped this game as you really have no real idea of what's going on, what you are doing or where you are going in these strange worlds.

reviewText: Very good horror game for an indie game made by one person. Though I don't prefer horrors, Cubium Dreams really gives me creeps while playing; last time I felt something like that when I was playing Antichamber. Recommend to try both games ;)
